message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings suggest possible multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2 (MEN2). Among the options, RET gene mutations are associated with MEN2, while FBN1 gene mutations are associated with Marfan syndrome, TSC2 gene mutations are associated with tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 gene mutations are associated with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical findings suggest multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2B (MEN2B), and mutations in the RET gene are commonly associated with MEN2B. FBN1 mutations are associated with Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations are associated with tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 mutations are associated with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, multiple papules on the tongue, and long and slender extremities suggest a diagnosis of Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia Type 2 (MEN2), which is caused by mutations in the RET gene. FBN1 mutations are associated with Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations with tuberous sclerosis complex and COL5A1 mutations with Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings are consistent with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2B (MEN 2B). Among the options, only mutations in the RET gene are associated with MEN 2B. FBN1 mutations lead to Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations lead to tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 mutations lead to Ehlers-Danlos syndrome type I.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The soft, yellow papules on the tongue and the firm thyroid nodule suggest the condition is Multiple Endocrine Neoplasia type 2 (MEN2). Among the options, a mutation in the RET gene is associated with MEN2. FBN1 mutations cause Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations cause tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 mutations cause Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical examination findings are consistent with a diagnosis of multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2A (MEN2A). MEN2A is caused by a germline mutation in the RET gene. FBN1 mutations cause Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations cause tuberous sclerosis complex, and COL5A1 mutations cause Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and physical findings are consistent with neurofibromatosis type 1. Among the options, only RET gene mutations are associated with neurofibromatosis type 1, as well as with multiple endocrine neoplasia types 2A and 2B, which can also present with symptoms similar to this patient's condition.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest the patient has multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2 (MEN2), which is caused by a mutation in RET gene. The yellow papules on the tip of the tongue and the firm thyroid nodule also support this diagnosis. FBN1 gene mutations cause Marfan syndrome, TSC2 gene mutations cause tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 gene mutations cause Ehlers-Danlos syndrome. None of these conditions are associated with the symptoms described in the question.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest the possibility of multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2 (MEN2). Among the options, only RET gene mutations cause MEN2. This gene encodes for the RET receptor tyrosine kinase, which is involved in the development of neural crest cells that give rise to several types of cells, including those of the thyroid, adrenal gland, and pancreas.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest the possibility of multiple endocrine neoplasia type 2A (MEN2A), which is caused by mutations in the RET gene. Yellow papules on the tongue, a firm thyroid nodule, and high blood pressure are all characteristic of MEN2A. The other options are not associated with these symptoms. FBN1 mutations cause Marfan syndrome, TSC2 mutations cause tuberous sclerosis, and COL5A1 mutations cause Ehlers-Danlos syndrome.
